revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=WPR |action1date=28 February 2007 |action1link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Peer review/Operation Barrel Roll |action1result=reviewed |action1oldid=111700191 |action2=WAR |action2date=9 March 2007 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Operation Barrel Roll |action2result=approved |action2oldid=113664493 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Cold War|class=A|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Southeast Asia|class=B|Laos=yes|LaosImp=}} {{WPMILHIST|class=A|A-Class=pass|US=yes|Southeast-Asian=yes|Aviation=yes|old-peer-review=yes |portal1-name=United States Air Force|portal1-link=Article Spotlight/17}} {{WikiProject Vietnam|class=A|importance=mid}} }} {{OnThisDay|date1=2013-03-29|oldid1=547408840}} ==Page move?== I was going to move this page, but I want to see if I was right in my suspicions. The word "Barrel" in this article title is spelled incorrectly (there's an extra l). All sources I've seen on this topic say it's spelled "barrel". Would it be improper to move this article to its correct spelling? '''[[User:.V.|.V.]]''' [[[User talk:.V.|Talk]]|[[Special:Emailuser/.V.|Email]]] 12:37, 17 February 2007 (UTC) *Go right ahead. You are correct in your spelling. Just itchy on the index fingers, I guess, although the spelling would have been corrected as the article moves toward completion. What do you think about how its shaping up? [[User:RM Gillespie|RM Gillespie]] 13:13, 17 February 2007 (UTC) : Done. :) I think this article is shaping up pretty well! It looks very nicely constructed. '''[[User:.V.|.V.]]''' [[[User talk:.V.|Talk]]|[[Special:Emailuser/.V.|Email]]] 16:04, 19 February 2007 (UTC) ==Better photos== There are any number of better photos of T-28s in Laos than the black-on-black obscurity presently in the article. Cannot someone with skills superior to mine dub one in? Also, a photo of a [[forward air control]] plane would be great, whether an O-1, O-2, or OV-10. And a photo of fighter-bombers, preferably in action against the Ho Chi Minh Trail. [[User:Georgejdorner|Georgejdorner]] ([[User talk:Georgejdorner|talk]]) 23:22, 14 November 2010 (UTC) == New primary source == There's a note in the conclusion that "The War in Northern Laos" would never see the light of day. Here's a link that could use digesting. I intend to read up on it myself, but I'm not much of a wiki coder. http://www.gwu.edu/~nsarchiv/NSAEBB/NSAEBB248/index.htm http://www.gwu.edu/~nsarchiv/NSAEBB/NSAEBB248/war_in_northern_laos.pdf â€” Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/75.72.150.130|75.72.150.130]] ([[User talk:75.72.150.130|talk]]) 14:25, 26 March 2012 (UTC) : I noticed that as well, and the problem is that the quote is from a 1988 book (''The Ravens'', by Christopher Robbins), and ''The War in Northern Laos'' was only published in 1993 according to the [[National Security Archive]] [http://www.gwu.edu/~nsarchiv/NSAEBB/NSAEBB248/index.htm website]. : I have therefore deleted the assertion and source from the article. :: [[User:Mojowiha|Mojowiha]] ([[User talk:Mojowiha|talk]]) 17:20, 22 September 2012 (UTC)
